interpreter
Class Turtle

java.lang.Object
  interpreter.Turtle

public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object

Turtle class which indicate the state of the turtle on screen.

Version:
March 30, 2009
Author:
David Matuszek, Xiaolu Xu

Constructor Summary
Turtle(DrawingArea canvas)
          Creates a Turtle in the center of the specified DrawingCanvas, facing right.
 
Method Summary
 void color(int number)
          Tells this turtle which color pen to use.
 void color(java.lang.String colorName)
          Tells this turtle which color pen to use.
 void face(double degrees)
          Sets the degrees that this turtle faces.
 void forward(double distance)
          Moves this Turtle forward the specified distance.
 double getX()
          gets the x coordinate of the turtle.
 double getY()
          gets the y coordinate of the turtle.
 void home()
          Moves this Turtle to the center of the drawing area, facing right.
 void initialize()
          Make sure this turtle (and its associated canvas) is in a known initial state.
 void left(double angle)
          Turns this Turtle to the left by the specified angle.
 void pendown()
          Tells this turtle to lower the pen.
 void penup()
          Tells this turtle to raise the pen.
 void right(double angle)
          Turns this Turtle to the right by the specified angle.
 void setPaintDelay(int ms)
          Tells this turtle how log to pause between turtle operations.
 void setPaused(boolean paused)
          If the parameter is true, causes the turtle to stop whatever it is doing and wait for another call of this method with the parameter false.
 void setPosition(double newX, double newY)
          Make the turtle jump to the specified position.
 void setSpeed(int oldSpeed)
          Sets the turtle speed.

setPaintDelay

public void setPaintDelay(int ms)
Tells this turtle how log to pause between turtle operations.

Parameters:
ms - The number of milliseconds (1/1000s of a second) to pause.

setPaused

public void setPaused(boolean paused)
If the parameter is true, causes the turtle to stop whatever it is doing and wait for another call of this method with the parameter false.

Parameters:
paused - Whether the turtle should be paused.

setSpeed

public void setSpeed(int oldSpeed)
Sets the turtle speed.

Parameters:
oldSpeed - A value from 0 (stopped) to 100 (full speed).
